title: Classifying Student Engagement in Education Using a Deep Learning-Based Feedback System

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of machine learning concepts and Python programming proficiency
context.additional_context: Environment enabling real-time participation monitoring and feedback via digital devices. Focused on professionals analyzing their engagement patterns and developing improvement strategies in language education

learning_goals: Learners can classify student engagement levels into four stages (very high, high, low, very low) with over 80% accuracy using a deep learning model (EfficientNet).
Learners can design a normalization loss function based on Inverse Class Frequency to address class imbalance issues.
Learners can implement a customized feedback system based on text and video data extracted from the DAiSEE dataset and evaluate its real-time applicability in small classrooms.

resources: Google Colab or Equivalent GPU Environment

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
